summary.body: Hi there Apologies in advance for making my first post a contentious one. We have been thinking about moving to the Barbican for some years. In 2003 it was possible to buy a split level 1 bed flat for about 275K. Unfortunately, for various reasons, we did not take this opportunity. Similar flats now appear to be on the market for 400K and over. Studios for 300K. I would like to ask longer-term residents: do prices tend to reflect the ups and downs of the stock market and the fortunes of the City? Did the prices of Barbican flats fall in the last recession, or did they hold up? If prices continue on their upward spiral, I guess we will have to give up the idea of ever moving here. A third of a million pounds for a single room is a bit steep, even if it's in the best place to live in London! Best wishes to all.
summary.subject: Barbican flat price fluctuations?

summary.body: Dear all,  I am considering buying a large studio (currently renting one). I am doing my "price discovery" howework now. There are records of sold prices at nethouseprices.com. However, only flat numbers and prices are available. For example,  Abcd Court, Flat 123, 234,000, 01-Jan-2007. What is the easiest way to determine flat type (e.g., F2B) given flat number? Calling into each of the flats in the appropriate price range and asking "what is your flat type, please?" is probably not such a great idea... (I personally would not mind if someone called into my flat with such a question, but this does not mean that I can bother others...) Would the Estate Office be able to provide such information? Or could you recommend another source, please? Thank you.
summary.subject: Block + Flat number ---> Flat type?
